1 #permalink Colors

A curated color palette using OKLCH color space for consistent, accessible, and perceptually uniform colors across the design system.

Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 1

1.5 #permalink Animations

Keyframe animations used across the design system.

Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_animations.scss, line 3

1.5.1 #permalink Stars Animations

Keyframe animations for the starfield parallax effect. Used by the .stars module to create depth and fading layers.

Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_animations.scss, line 9

1.1 #permalink Complete Palette

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

All five colors derived from the base color. This palette matches the Coolors scheme: https://coolors.co/bdede0-bbdbd1-070322-7e78d2-6f58c9

Example
Accent
#bdede0
Surface
#bbdbd1
Base
#3A1477
Secondary
#7e78d2
Primary
#6f58c9
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr); gap: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-accent); padding: 30px; color: var(--base-color); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Accent</strong><br>#bdede0
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-surface); padding: 30px; color: var(--base-color); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Surface</strong><br>#bbdbd1
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-color); padding: 30px; color: white; text-align: center;">
    <strong>Base</strong><br>#3A1477
  </div>
</div>
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr); gap: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-secondary); padding: 30px; color: white; text-align: center;">
    <strong>Secondary</strong><br>#7e78d2
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-primary); padding: 30px; color: white; text-align: center;">
    <strong>Primary</strong><br>#6f58c9
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 8

1.2 #permalink Neutral Colors

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Near-black and near-white colors for better visual comfort. Avoiding pure #000000 and #ffffff reduces eye strain and provides better color harmonization.

Example
Black
#0a0a0a
White
#fafafa
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr); gap: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-black); padding: 30px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Black</strong><br>#0a0a0a
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-white); padding: 30px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; border: 1px solid #ddd;">
    <strong>White</strong><br>#fafafa
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 38

1.2.1 #permalink Grey Scale

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Ten perceptually uniform grey shades generated using color-mix() in OKLCH color space. This ensures consistent visual steps between black and white, following modern CSS baseline practices.

Example
100
200
300
400
500
600
700
800
900
White
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(5, 1fr); gap: 5px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-100); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>100</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-200); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>200</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-300); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>300</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-400); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>400</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-500); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>500</strong>
  </div>
</div>
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(5, 1fr); gap: 5px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-600); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>600</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-700); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>700</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-800); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>800</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--grey-900); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>900</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-white); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px; border: 1px solid var(--grey-300);">
    <strong>White</strong>
  </div>
</div>

1.2.2 #permalink Base Scale

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Nine perceptually uniform shades derived from the base color using color-mix() in OKLCH. 100 is the darkest (near-black tinted), 500 is the base color, 900 is the lightest.

Example
100
200
300
400
500
600
700
800
900
Base
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(5, 1fr); gap: 5px; margin-bottom: 5px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-100); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>100</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-200); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>200</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-300); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>300</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-400); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>400</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-500); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>500</strong>
  </div>
</div>
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(5, 1fr); gap: 5px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-600); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>600</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-700); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>700</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-800); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>800</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-900); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>900</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--base-color); padding: 25px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center; font-size: 12px;">
    <strong>Base</strong>
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 103

1.2.3 #permalink Background Colors

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Dark background shades for page, section, and card surfaces. All derived from the base color, providing depth through subtle tinting.

Example
Page
--bg-page
Section
--bg-section
Card
--bg-card
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr); gap: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--bg-page); padding: 30px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Page</strong><br>--bg-page
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--bg-section); padding: 30px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Section</strong><br>--bg-section
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--bg-card); padding: 30px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Card</strong><br>--bg-card
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 148

1.2.4 #permalink Glow & Gradient Colors

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Vibrant tones for glow effects, gradients, and light accents. These provide the luminous, ethereal quality seen in the design.

Example
Glow Core + Mid
Gradient
Glow Soft
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr); gap: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px;">
  <div style="background: radial-gradient(circle, var(--glow-core), var(--glow-mid), transparent); padding: 40px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Glow Core + Mid</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--gradient-start), var(--gradient-end)); padding: 40px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Gradient</strong>
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--glow-soft); padding: 40px; color: var(--color-white); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Glow Soft</strong>
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 170

1.3 #permalink Semantic Colors

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Colors mapped to specific use cases for consistency across the application. All derived from the base color using OKLCH transformations.

Example
Primary - Main brand color
Secondary - Supporting color
Accent - Highlight color
Surface - Background color
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr); gap: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-primary); padding: 20px; color: white;">
    Primary - Main brand color
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-secondary); padding: 20px; color: white;">
    Secondary - Supporting color
  </div>
</div>
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr); gap: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-accent); padding: 20px; color: var(--base-color);">
    Accent - Highlight color
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-surface); padding: 20px; color: var(--base-color); border: 1px solid var(--base-color);">
    Surface - Background color
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 192

1.3.1 #permalink Notification Colors

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Status colors for feedback and notifications. These use fixed OKLCH values rather than deriving from the base color, ensuring they remain recognisable regardless of brand colour changes.

Example
Error
--color-error
Alert
--color-alert
Info
--color-info
Success
--color-success
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr); gap: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-error); padding: 20px; color: white; text-align: center;">
    <strong>Error</strong><br>--color-error
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-alert); padding: 20px; color: var(--color-black); text-align: center;">
    <strong>Alert</strong><br>--color-alert
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-info); padding: 20px; color: white; text-align: center;">
    <strong>Info</strong><br>--color-info
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--color-success); padding: 20px; color: white; text-align: center;">
    <strong>Success</strong><br>--color-success
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 219

1.4 #permalink Action Colors

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup

Colors for interactive elements with hover and active states.

Examples
Default styling
Default
Hover
Active
--action-color
Default action state
Default
Hover
Active
--action-color-hover
Hover state (+10% lightness)
Default
Hover
Active
--action-color-active
Active/pressed state (-10% lightness)
Default
Hover
Active
Markup 
<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr); gap: 10px;">
  <div style="background-color: var(--action-color); padding: 20px; color: white;">
    Default
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--action-color-hover); padding: 20px; color: white;">
    Hover
  </div>
  <div style="background-color: var(--action-color-active); padding: 20px; color: white;">
    Active
  </div>
</div>
Source: src/assets/scss/theme/_colors.scss, line 245
